required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: EMD 525797 in Subjects With Asymptomatic or Mildly Symptomatic Metastatic Castrate-resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Phase II Trial Investigating Two Doses of EMD 525797 in Subjects With Asymptomatic or Mildly Symptomatic Metastatic Castrate-resistant Prostate Cancer (mCRPC)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the trial is to evaluate the clinical anti-tumor activity of EMD 525797 administered as 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks in terms of progression free survival (PFS) time in subjects with asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic metastatic castrate-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time from randomization until the first documented sign of objective radiographic disease progression (ORDP) or death from any cause. Death was considered as an event only if it was reported within 12 weeks after last tumor assessment without progression. ORDP was defined as: Bone lesion progression (2 or more new bone lesions compared to baseline) assessed with bone scintigraphy. Assessment was based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.0 (RECIST v1.0) modified as per Prostate Cancer Working Group 2 (PCWG-2); Soft-tissue lesion progression assessed with CT scans according to RECIST v1.0 modified as per PCWG-2; Presence of skeletal events defined as cord compression/fracture documented via a scheduled or unscheduled radiographic assessment triggered by increased pain or other signs and/or symptoms, based on the investigator's discretion; Non-radiological events, including emergency bone irradiation and surgery, were not investigated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to tumor progression was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of ORDP. ORDP was defined as: Bone lesion progression (2 or more new bone lesions compared to baseline) assessed with bone scintigraphy, which had to be confirmed by bone scintigraphy 6 weeks later if subjects remained asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic. Assessments were to be based on RECIST v1.0 modified according to PCWG-2; Soft-tissue lesion progression assessed with CT scans according to RECIST v1.0 modified as per PCWG-2; Presence of skeletal events defined as cord compression or fracture documented via a scheduled or unscheduled radiographic assessment triggered by increased pain or other signs and/or symptoms, based on the investigator's discretion; Non-radiological events, including emergency bone irradiation and surgery, were not investigated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Presence of Tumor Response and Disease Control (DC) in Soft Tissue Lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of tumor response in soft tissue lesions was defined as the presence of at least 1 confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) in soft tissue lesions, documented by computed tomography (CT) scans. Presence of DC in soft tissue lesions was defined as the presence of at least 1 confirmed CR or confirmed PR or stable disease (SD) lasting at least 12 weeks after randomization. Tumor response assessments were based on RECIST v1.0 modified according to the PCWG-2. The response was evaluated for subjects with measurable disease at baseline. According to RECIST v1.0, CR=disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions and non-complete response/non-progressive disease in non-target lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With New Bone Lesions Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: New bone lesions were evaluated by bone scintigraphy for subjects with bone lesions at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Presence of DC in Bone Lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of DC in bone lesions was defined as the appearance of less than 2 new bone lesions, documented by bone scintigraphy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone and Soft Tissue Lesions Composite Tumor Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Bone and soft tissue lesions composite tumor response was defined as the presence of both a confirmed CR or PR, documented by CT scans, and a DC in bone lesions, documented by bone scintigraphy. CR was defined as disappearance of all target and non-target lesions and PR was defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions and non-complete response/non-progressive disease in non-target lesions. Presence of DC in bone lesions was defined as the appearance of less than 2 new bone lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Presence of Skeletal Related Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of skeletal related events was defined as cord compression or fracture documented via a scheduled or unscheduled radiographic assessment triggered by increased pain or other signs and/or symptoms at the investigator discretion. Non-radiological events, including emergency bone irradiation and surgery, were not investigated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Presence of Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA) Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: PSA response was defined as a decrease greater than 50 percent (%) in PSA value from baseline for 2 consecutive evaluations greater than or equal to (>=) 3 Weeks apart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Percentage Change From Baseline in PSA Serum Concentration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Percentage Change From Baseline in the Number of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Minimum Percentage Change From Previous Time Point in Circulating Tumor Cells (CTC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1, Day 1 (Week 1): pre-dose, Cycle 3, Day 1 (Week 7): pre-dose, and Cycle 5, Day 1 (Week 13): pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious TEAEs, TEAEs Leading to Death, and TEAEs Leading to Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study drug administration until 50 days after the last dose of study drug administration or until cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrences/worsening of pre-existing medical condition without regard to possibility of causal relationship. A serious adverse event was an AE that resulted in any of the following outcomes: death; life threatening; persistent/significant disability/incapacity; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; congenital anomaly/birth defect. TEAEs were defined as those AEs that started between first dose of study drug and up to 50 days after last dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Clearance of Intravenously Administered EMD 525797 After First Dose (CL) and Clearance in Steady State of EMD52597 After Fifth Dose (CLss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 (Week 1) and cycle 5 (Week 13): Day 1: pre-dose, End of Infusion (EOI), 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 168, 336, and 504 hours after start of infusion; Cycles 3 and 4 (Weeks 7 and 10), Day 1: pre-dose; Cycle 7 (Week 19), Day 1: pre-dose and EOI
secondary_outcome.description: The apparent total body clearance of drug following intravenous administration (CL); The apparent total body clearance of drug at steady state following intravenous administration (CLss).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Volume of Distribution of EMD 525797 After the First Dose (V) and in Steady State After the Fifth Dose (Vss) of Intravenous Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 (Week 1) and cycle 5 (Week 13): Day 1: pre-dose, End of Infusion (EOI), 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 168, 336, and 504 hours after start of infusion; Cycles 3 and 4 (Weeks 7 and 10), Day 1: pre-dose; Cycle 7 (Week 19), Day 1: pre-dose and EOI
secondary_outcome.description: The apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase following intravenous administration (V). The estimate of the apparent volume of distribution at steady state following intravenous administration (Vss).

other_outcome.measure: To Explore the Relationship Between Number and/or Changes of Numbers of Biomarker and the Clinical Outcome
other_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization up to data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years

intervention.description: Subjects will be administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 1500 milligram (mg) (diluted with 0.9 percent [%] sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons.

Subjects will be administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 750 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons.

Subjects will be administered with placebo (as 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons.
All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate (Gleason score)
- Bisphosphonate treatment
- Stable, ongoing adequate testosterone suppression proven by hypogonadal levels of testosterone (less than or equal to) <= 50 nanogram per deciliter [ng/dL]) for subjects without surgical castration (luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone antagonists and agonists)
- Other protocol defined inclusion criteria could apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior chemotherapy, biologic therapy (targeted therapy), or any experimental therapy for mCRPC
- Chronic and ongoing treatment with opioids
- Acute pathologic fracture, spinal cord compression, or hypercalcemia at Screening
- Visceral metastasis, brain metastasis
- Radiotherapy to bone lesions and/or orthopedic surgery for pathologic fractures. Any kinds of major elective surgery within 30 days prior to trial treatment
- Other protocol defined exclusion criteria could apply

overall_official.affiliation: EMD Serono Inc., an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

facility.name: Hôpitaux Civils de Colmar-CH Louis Pasteur
Universitätsmedizin Charité, Campus Benjamin Franklin, Urologische Klinik and Poliklinik
Universitätsklinikum Carl Gustav Carus an der Techischen Universität Dresden, Klinik und Poliklinik für Urologie
Universitätsklinikum Tübinger, Klinik und Poliklinik für Urologie
State Institution of Healthcare Ivanovo Regional Oncology Dispensary
Krasnoyarsk State Medical University Oncology and Radiotherapy Territorial Dispensary

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First/Last subject (informed consent): April 2011/December 2012. Study completion date: July 2014. Clinical data cut-off: 30 April 2013. Subjects were recruited in 11 countries (Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland, Russia, South Africa, Spain, and USA) across the globe in 65 centers.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled: 283 screened for eligibility; 103 were excluded (mainly non-fulfillment of inclusion or exclusion criteria). 180 subjects were assigned to the treatment groups. Two subjects did not receive study drug administration.

group.title: Placebo + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with placebo 0.9% sodium chloride as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the standard of care (SoC) consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

group.title: EMD 525797 750 mg + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 750 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

group.title: EMD 525797 1500 mg + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 1500 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

baseline.population: All Subjects (ALL) analysis set included subjects who signed the Informed consent document.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) Time
outcome.description: PFS was defined as time from randomization until the first documented sign of objective radiographic disease progression (ORDP) or death from any cause. Death was considered as an event only if it was reported within 12 weeks after last tumor assessment without progression. ORDP was defined as: Bone lesion progression (2 or more new bone lesions compared to baseline) assessed with bone scintigraphy. Assessment was based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.0 (RECIST v1.0) modified as per Prostate Cancer Working Group 2 (PCWG-2); Soft-tissue lesion progression assessed with CT scans according to RECIST v1.0 modified as per PCWG-2; Presence of skeletal events defined as cord compression/fracture documented via a scheduled or unscheduled radiographic assessment triggered by increased pain or other signs and/or symptoms, based on the investigator’s discretion; Non-radiological events, including emergency bone irradiation and surgery, were not investigated.

group.title: EMD 525797 1500 mg + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 1500 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Presence of DC in Bone Lesions
measure.description: Presence of DC in bone lesions was defined as the appearance of less than 2 new bone lesions, documented by bone scintigraphy.
measure.population: ITT analysis set included all the subjects randomized in the study.

outcome.title: Bone and Soft Tissue Lesions Composite Tumor Response
outcome.description: Bone and soft tissue lesions composite tumor response was defined as the presence of both a confirmed CR or PR, documented by CT scans, and a DC in bone lesions, documented by bone scintigraphy. CR was defined as disappearance of all target and non-target lesions and PR was defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions and non-complete response/non-progressive disease in non-target lesions. Presence of DC in bone lesions was defined as the appearance of less than 2 new bone lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
outcome.population: ITT analysis set included all the subjects who were randomized in the study.

group.title: Placebo + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with placebo 0.9% sodium chloride as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

group.title: EMD 525797 750 mg + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 750 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

group.title: EMD 525797 1500 mg + SoC

All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

measure.title: Bone and Soft Tissue Lesions Composite Tumor Response
measure.description: Bone and soft tissue lesions composite tumor response was defined as the presence of both a confirmed CR or PR, documented by CT scans, and a DC in bone lesions, documented by bone scintigraphy. CR was defined as disappearance of all target and non-target lesions and PR was defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions and non-complete response/non-progressive disease in non-target lesions. Presence of DC in bone lesions was defined as the appearance of less than 2 new bone lesions.
measure.population: ITT analysis set included all the subjects who were randomized in the study.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Presence of Skeletal Related Events
outcome.description: Presence of skeletal related events was defined as cord compression or fracture documented via a scheduled or unscheduled radiographic assessment triggered by increased pain or other signs and/or symptoms at the investigator discretion. Non-radiological events, including emergency bone irradiation and surgery, were not investigated.
outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
outcome.population: ITT analysis set included all the subjects who were randomized in the study.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Presence of Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA) Response
outcome.description: PSA response was defined as a decrease greater than 50 percent (%) in PSA value from baseline for 2 consecutive evaluations greater than or equal to (>=) 3 Weeks apart.
outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization until data cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
outcome.population: ITT analysis set included all the subjects who were randomized in the study. “N” signifies the total number of subjects evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious TEAEs, TEAEs Leading to Death, and TEAEs Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrences/worsening of pre-existing medical condition without regard to possibility of causal relationship. A serious adverse event was an AE that resulted in any of the following outcomes: death; life threatening; persistent/significant disability/incapacity; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; congenital anomaly/birth defect. TEAEs were defined as those AEs that started between first dose of study drug and up to 50 days after last dose.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study drug administration until 50 days after the last dose of study drug administration or until cut-off date (30 April 2013), assessed up to 2 years
outcome.population: The Safety analysis set included all the randomized subjects who received at least 1 dose of planned trial treatment and had at least one safety assessment following the trial treatment.

group.title: Placebo + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with placebo 0.9% sodium chloride as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

group.title: EMD 525797 750 mg + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 750 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 1500 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious TEAEs, TEAEs Leading to Death, and TEAEs Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrences/worsening of pre-existing medical condition without regard to possibility of causal relationship. A serious adverse event was an AE that resulted in any of the following outcomes: death; life threatening; persistent/significant disability/incapacity; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; congenital anomaly/birth defect. TEAEs were defined as those AEs that started between first dose of study drug and up to 50 days after last dose.
measure.population: The Safety analysis set included all the randomized subjects who received at least 1 dose of planned trial treatment and had at least one safety assessment following the trial treatment.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Clearance of Intravenously Administered EMD 525797 After First Dose (CL) and Clearance in Steady State of EMD52597 After Fifth Dose (CLss)
outcome.description: The apparent total body clearance of drug following intravenous administration (CL); The apparent total body clearance of drug at steady state following intravenous administration (CLss).
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 (Week 1) and cycle 5 (Week 13): Day 1: pre-dose, End of Infusion (EOI), 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 168, 336, and 504 hours after start of infusion; Cycles 3 and 4 (Weeks 7 and 10), Day 1: pre-dose; Cycle 7 (Week 19), Day 1: pre-dose and EOI
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PKA) included all the randomized subjects who received at least the first dose of the trial drug and provided sufficient data for a concentration time profile for EMD 525797. "n" signifies the number of subjects evaluable for each category in the evaluated group, respectively.

group.title: EMD 525797 750 mg + SoC
group.description: Subjects were administered with EMD 525797 at a dose of 750 mg (diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride) as a 1-hour intravenous infusion every 3 Weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity, whichever comes first, unless the subject stopped the trial treatment for other reasons. All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

All the subjects followed the SoC consisting of the continued treatment with luteinizing-hormone releasing hormone agonists (or antagonists). In order to avoid any confounding effects, bisphosphonate treatment was initiated 2 days before start of treatment with EMD 525797.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Clearance of Intravenously Administered EMD 525797 After First Dose (CL) and Clearance in Steady State of EMD52597 After Fifth Dose (CLss)
measure.description: The apparent total body clearance of drug following intravenous administration (CL); The apparent total body clearance of drug at steady state following intravenous administration (CLss).
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PKA) included all the randomized subjects who received at least the first dose of the trial drug and provided sufficient data for a concentration time profile for EMD 525797. "n" signifies the number of subjects evaluable for each category in the evaluated group, respectively.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Volume of Distribution of EMD 525797 After the First Dose (V) and in Steady State After the Fifth Dose (Vss) of Intravenous Infusion
outcome.description: The apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase following intravenous administration (V). The estimate of the apparent volume of distribution at steady state following intravenous administration (Vss).
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 (Week 1) and cycle 5 (Week 13): Day 1: pre-dose, End of Infusion (EOI), 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 168, 336, and 504 hours after start of infusion; Cycles 3 and 4 (Weeks 7 and 10), Day 1: pre-dose; Cycle 7 (Week 19), Day 1: pre-dose and EOI
outcome.population: PKA included all the randomized subjects who received at least the first dose of the trial drug and provided sufficient data for a concentration time profile for EMD 525797. "n" signifies the number of subjects evaluable for each category in the evaluated group, respectively.

measurement_list.measurement: The sample size of n=2 was inappropriate for Vss parameter to calculate standard deviation. Hence, it was not calculated.
